name: BEST WESTERN Gatwick Moat House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Scond time we have stayed here, the location is great for the airport, however the car park is small and cramped. The room is comfortable and not a bad size, the bathroom is practical with great water pressure. Considering it is so close to the airport there is almost no noise. Ate in the restuarant, good value £29.99 for 2 courses and a glass of wine for 2 people, not bad overall and we couldn't finish ours.
reviews.title: Great location, nice room

reviews.text: We booked this as part of a hotel and parking package prior to our holiday and were very happy with the value for money.
reviews.title: Great hotel deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff were friendly and very welcoming. Room was a great size for 5 of us and had views of the airport which added to our excitement. The kids loved the towel animals on the beds.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations for a three-star airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the bar was a little pricey but delicious!!
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: The hotel itself was clean and presentable and excellent proximity to the airport. Car parking was secure and easily accessable.
reviews.title: Great place for a pre-flight stay with parking deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed overnight following a late flight back to the UK and would definitely use this hotel again. We'd left the car in the secure hotel car park whilst away and used the shuttle transport to and from Gatwick airport which was frequent and easy. Check-in was quick and efficient and the staff helpful and polite. Our room was clean and very comfortable with a good en-suite and we had a good night's sleep. Being so close to the airport we did wonder if there may have been some take-off and landing noise, but there was none. Would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Deserves an extra star

reviews.text: This hotel surprised me, it exceeded my expectations, I liked it.
reviews.title: Expectations exceeded.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a typical 'transit' hotel, it's close proximity to Gatwick means it acts as a staging post for holiday makers and business travellers, so in many respects it has a ready made and continuous market of guests.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for Gatwick airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The temptation of course, with a never ending supply of guests is to take the money and do little to earn it. I'm sure that most readers will have had that feeling when staying in hotels in similar locations, but this is not the case at the Moat House. The staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful. In my case they helped resolve, without fuss an elementary mistake I'd made in my booking.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: The building itself is truly ugly and the decor is without doubt dated, so its not the height of contemporary luxury, but my room was spotlessly clean and I had a couple of great nights sleep. The maids respect the 'do not disturb' sign, which makes a change from the usual habit of countless knocks at the door, that I've experienced in other establishments.
reviews.title: Short 1 night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed at this hotel for one night with 16 days parking, a very clean hotel with excellent staff, the room was sufficiant for one night and a very good rate.
reviews.title: Good Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to our flight landing at nearly midnight and a journey back to the midlands, when the weather forcast was further snow we dicided to stay at the hotel another night, checking the price at 93 euros on the internet direct with the hotel I found it to be just 53 euros with booking.com.
reviews.title: Ideal for a stay before a flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downturn from a 5 rating is the amount of parking space in the multi storey if you have a big car it is very difficult to park and exit the barrier.
reviews.title: Good parking package, convenient and efficient

reviews.text: We just stayed 1 night here before an early flight from Gatwick. All booked online including parking for a week for £79. The staff were helpful when we arrived to find no available spaces to park, they quickly got someone who worked there to move their car to free up a space. The room was OK and clean. On our return the collection of the car was quick and easy too.
reviews.title: More goat house than moat house
Better than expected.
reviews.text: We chose the Maple Manor return greet package and it was this that made it a good choice and good value. Arriving back in the late evening it was great to walk out of departures to step straight in to our own car and set off home with no waiting for courtesy buses.

We booked into this hotel so that we did not have far to travel the following day for our flight to America. Excellent facilities, not crowded and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel, close to Gatwick airport then this should be considered as a possibility. We booked parking separately but our niece and family left their car at the hotel. There is a small charge of £3 for the transfer.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights recently, found it clean and tidy, breakfast was excellent, staff very helpfull, will stay again.Shuttle bus was regular to Gatwick £3 per person each way was probably the worst bit about the stay.
reviews.title: lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked as a car park and one night sleepover before travelling home. Noisy room (222) due to a generator or something outside that was chugging all night ! Luckily we were only crashing before the drive home. The lift doesn't access the carpark which means lugging heavy cases up stairs to the adjacent car park.
reviews.title: Ok just for a place to sleep

reviews.text: Comfortable lounge / bar with an excellent bar menu that was delicious and nicely presented.It is a shame there are 2 game machines in the area, the black and white tiles round the bar also ,in the dining area and the large poster advertising pie and beer make the hotel look "cheap"The dining room looked pleasant and spacious with a good choice on the menu.The ladies toilet was very clean but the edges of the stair carpet needs cleaning.
reviews.title: excellent find but decor could be more tasteful

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Moat House,
reviews.title: Perfect Overnight Family Airport Hotel

aka: Best Western Gatwick Moat House Hotel Horley
description: Located less than a mile from Gatwick Airport and train station, the hotel has had a complete refurbishment and transformation in 2006. Offering 125 non-smoking, air-conditioned bedrooms, all with wireless internet access. The hotel also benefits from having a new range of family bedrooms sleeping between two and seven guests. A shuttle service to the airport is available 24-hours.
